oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Volunteer enlistment for farmer Elie Nelson
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- Army -- Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, 5th (1862-1865); Recruiting & enlistment; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This form records the enlistment of farmer Elie Nelson in Nashville on December 1, 1862. He is examined by a lieutenant in the 1st Regiment Middle Tennessee Volunteers. Nelson makes his mark to sign both his oath and the declaration of recruitment. The document includes his description and a section for consent in case of minor (which is left blank).
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Elie Nelson was born in Coffee County, Tennessee, around 1841. He was six feet, three inches tall with blue eyes, light hair, and a fair complexion. His enlistment is dated December 1, 1862, and his age is listed as twenty-one.
